./.title: Introduction
./.body: Preface Scaling: Horizontal Scaling (scaling out) - improving performance by running more instances (更多員工) Vertical scaling (scaling in) - move to a powerful machine (找更有能力的員工) Structure of This book: How the database system stored and how they distribute the data Part I - Store architecture of a database management system. Ways to classify the database system by the primary storage medium and layout. how disk-based structures are different from in-memory ones. B-Tree and algorithms for efficiently maintaining B-Tree. Variants to illustrate the power of [4] and the diversity of data structure influenced and inspired by B-Tree. Varients of log-structured storage. Part II - Distribution How to organize multiple nodes into a database cluster The importance of building fault-tolerance distributed systems. How distributed systems are different from single-node applications. (problems, constraints, and complications) Algorithms for failure detection
